channel.title: Smallest Java class
channel.description:
Some time ago I had the idea of making the BIGGEST Java class possible, but then I just couldn't be bothered to create it, so I wrote the smallest class possible instead. I deleted it soon enough as it was pointless, but last night somehow I mentioned it to RLN and rewrote it to show it to him.
It extends itself, which is basically illegal, but the class loses 7 bytes in size, and is still accepted by at east javac and javap, so why not :P
Here's the whole beauty in 31 bytes. [code]CAFE BABE 0000 0031 0003 0100 0141 0700 0100 0000 0200 0200 0000 0000 0000 00[/code]
[url=http://koti.mbnet.fi/jass0/A.class]http://koti.mbnet.fi/jass0/A.class[/url]

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

[quote=“ilyaostr9, post:31, topic:47248”][quote author=k00dr link=topic=65888.msg781136#msg781136 date=1168987724]

Would you be able to make a class that extends the primitive types that way >

Nope, but check this out, lawl

I bet some arrogant bitch is thinking “oh mai godz he finks his teh kewl lawl noes how 2 tyep bitechodes lol anyoon ken dew it!1”,
so I will confirm that information, just to be sure. (paranoia?)
It is easy, the VM specification is easy to read, even for people who don’t want to learn (RLN) and just want to learn the binary structure of classes (RLN).

A five-year-old could do what I just did.
I’m just simply having fun, seeing as the topic is original.
[/quote]
int.class wtf? I’m guessing the sauce is

class int extends int {}

if i put that in an IDE, all the text would be dark blue lelelele[/quote]Nope, it’s class int extends short{}

Read full topic

Would you be able to make a class that extends the primitive types that way >
[/quote]

Nope, but check this out, lawl

I bet some arrogant bitch is thinking “oh mai godz he finks his teh kewl lawl noes how 2 tyep bitechodes lol anyoon ken dew it!1”,
so I will confirm that information, just to be sure. (paranoia?)
It is easy, the VM specification is easy to read, even for people who don’t want to learn (RLN) and just want to learn the binary structure of classes (RLN).

A five-year-old could do what I just did.
I’m just simply having fun, seeing as the topic is original.[/quote]
int.class wtf? I’m guessing the sauce is

class int extends int {}

if i put that in an IDE, all the text would be dark blue lelelele

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @Goat_Spirit Goat Spirit
item.description:
@Goat_Spirit wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:26, topic:47248”]Goat Spirit, do you know what a primitive type is? lemme explain:

Primitive Data Types: int, double, long, etc.,
Primitive Type Wrappers: The classes that make up int, double, long, etc., (eg., java.lang.Integer)

White Castle was saying that you can extend the wrapper classes, but not the int’s and double’s themselves. Basically he was just saying what a neeby comment Javacisnotrecognized made :P[/quote]
I thought those were called variables?

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

I want classes that can be used as primitive types God damnit !

In 5.0+ you can use the wrapper classes as primitive types (autoboxing etc)

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

I want classes that can be used as primitive types God damnit !

That’s seems pretty contradictory to me.
Or do you mean like, being able to make new name definitions for the existing primitives?

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest Java class

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Goat Spirit, do you know what a primitive type is? lemme explain:

Primitive Data Types: int, double, long, etc.,
Primitive Type Wrappers: The classes that make up int, double, long, etc., (eg., java.lang.Integer)

White Castle was saying that you can extend the wrapper classes, but not the int’s and double’s themselves. Basically he was just saying what a neeby comment Javacisnotrecognized made

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @Goat_Spirit Goat Spirit
item.description:
@Goat_Spirit wrote:

White Castle:

Well, you could extend primitive type wrapper classes, such as java.lang.Integer or java.lang.Double because they extend java.lang.Object, but not the primitive data types themselves.

Eh, your confusing me. I’ll stick to the basics for now.

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

Would you be able to make a class that extends the primitive types that way >

Nope, but check this out, lawl

I bet some arrogant bitch is thinking “oh mai godz he finks his teh kewl lawl noes how 2 tyep bitechodes lol anyoon ken dew it!1”,
so I will confirm that information, just to be sure. (paranoia?)
It is easy, the VM specification is easy to read, even for people who don’t want to learn (RLN) and just want to learn the binary structure of classes (RLN).

A five-year-old could do what I just did.
I’m just simply having fun, seeing as the topic is original.

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

bullzeye:

How did you make that first class k00dr? If i try to put class A extends A{} I get what Ilya got.

I crafted it manually by the jvm specification, and like someone said, javac doesn’t let you compile a class that extends itself.
The main reason I made it extend itself was to lose those 7 bytes.

Read full topic

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @Goat_Spirit Goat Spirit
item.description:
@Goat_Spirit wrote:

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/javaOO/classes.html
It’s so you can compile a class with methods, but it cannot be run. Sort of a library.
Sorry if yall thought I was talking about something else.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“Goat Spirit, post:12, topic:47248”] class a{}
Should compile but you cannot run it.[/quote]
if it extends a, then you’d get a ClassCircularity exception. It’s a freakin paradox

item.title: Smallest Java class
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Well, native methods aren’t written in the class, and therefore don’t increase the class size.
Now we can just forget about the whole biggest class, because according to my calculations, it would be a beast.

Read full topic
